reviewText:
This game is epic.

Your choices control the story for what your character will become, his skills and how the plot will follow. I feel like I'm reading a mythology book, except that I'm choosing where it leads and how the other characters are affected by my decisions during the journey.

It was my first time playing this kind of game and I enjoyed it more than i thought i would. It's really well written and for those with good imagination it will be surely plenty of fun.
voteText: 25 of 27 people (93%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText: CHampion of the Gods is a interactive novel heavily based in Greek mythology. It follow the tale of (you guessed it) the champion of the gods and the choices and dilemmas he faces in his destiny. The story is a decent length, when compared to other Choice Games interactive novels. The pacing is quite good, and there are a fair amount of action moments in the story. It took me only an hour to read, so interpret that how you will. The story is pretty good, and the author's creativity shows through clearly, blending their own writing style with the lore of the gods and fate. I did not notice any spelling or grammar errors in my reading of the story. Overall, an enjoyable read, especially at sale price. Supporting these kind of stories if you enjoy them also helps get more published on Steam. If you ever enjoyed stories about Greek mythology (Heracles, Perseus, etc.), this is  a must read.
voteText: 23 of 27 people (85%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
No save points yet and it's getting really tiring
Choice of Gamers is bringing back Choose-Your-Own-Adventure and they've had some good games, I've played FateHaven, Choice of Robots, MechaAce, and now Champion of the Gods (have others that I haven't gotten to yet, almost like my shelves of actual books!) Most of which I own on other devices out side of Steam.

Out of all those Choice of Robots would be my favorite with MechaAce close behind and I recommend both because while the plot is still somewhat linear the branches have more impact. Champion of the Gods, follows more along the lines of FateHaven and for those unfamiliar it comes down to making a choice, and still being shoehorned along one path.

I still yearn for a save function as well, most argue that it gives choices more impact but ultimately it really kills replayability, want to see what happens at the end if you pick choice B instead of A? You have to replay the whole thing. From the beginning.

It's frustrating. Also, I don't know offhand if there are keyboard shortcuts, I've tried some of the obvious choices but it seems the mouse is the only method to advance through the pages. Nothing even lines up either so you can't just place your mouse and click to skip through dialogue you've already read.

Considering the amount of games they have under their belt now this still hasn't changed, and it needs to.

The writing is alright, it's the main (and arguably only) appeal of the game so how does it hold up? It's good. It's still has the draw that will keep you up for 'just a bit more' to see what happens next. Recently it's come to my attention that some of the wording in their games is due to their political stances and requirements they place which just seems kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥. The thread is in the community discussions, might be gone if you're seeing this later but it might not.

It's not the reason for the No vote though, the reason is I'm sick and tired of the crap save system. I want save points, I kept bookmarks for actual books like this why can't I have save points so I can go back to a point in the story without GOING THROUGH THE ENTIRE GAME?!
voteText: 23 of 35 people (66%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Quite a decent choose your own adventure.  Your earlier choices do matter - I'm not sure how many distinct endings there are, but at about two hours for first play and an hour for another it seems to have quite a lot of replay potential.\n\nI've beaten it once playing as I really wanted to and then as a huge arrogant Hercules-type a-hole, and want to try it again. The main plot doesn't change (you start in your village, then go here, then here, then here...) but you can change quite a bit and I still have some 'but what if I...' that I want to test.

reviewText: If you enjoy choose your own adventure books, you'll love this game! There's no sound, no graphics, it's a well written story that's a fun adventurous read. You choose what the main character does, how he/she feels, who he/she loves and what unique powers he/she has. It's a lot of fun and I can't wait to finish the story!

reviewText: The story is fun, puts you into Greek mythology. My only complaint is that there are times when you feel like the game presents you with nothing more than the illusion of choice. Meaning the game appears to be offering you a genuine choice of several very different options yet whichever you choose the result will be the same with only lipservice paid to the actual choice you made. So...I'm unsure how many real 'change the plot' choices there are or if the plot is basically set in stone and you are just dictating the tone/dialogue/windowdressing.

reviewText: I enjoyed the unique setting (I haven't seen many Greco-Roman influenced fantasy worlds) and the chance to switch viewpoints at a few points in the story, something I haven't seen in many other CoG works.  I highly recommend this and other Choice of Games stories for fans of choice-based storygames such as Life is Strange, Heavy Rain, or the current Telltale games.

reviewText:
Okay first things first, if you don't like reading or COYA games then you will not like this game most likely.
This game is not for everone, I understand that, but if you enjoy these types of games even the slightest then I recomend this game to you.

My first playthrough took me about an hour and a half to maybe two hours.
So far after about 5 hours straight of playing this game I would say for the price of 2.99 that it is ATM, I say buy it if you can.

Okay now to pros and cons

____Pros____
Superb writing
Charater creation melded well, with out feeling to out of place
Good illusion of choice (I'll get to this in a second)
Passages don't get to long easy to stay focused
good amout of replayabilty
super fun
great characters


____Cons____
Now back to that thing illusion of choice, what do I mean by this.  Well after going through the story four or five times I began to realize that some of the options you pick don't actually do anything
as far as I see.  Nothing game changing but I was kind of dissapointed that they did not do anything
The stats besides the fighting ones are never really explained at all and you are never really shown by the game what they do to your story.  I think they alter what option you can pick at the end (No spoilers) but I have yet to test this theory.


All and all its a good game for the price it's at. while I feel I could get a flash game with the same amount of content.  The writer and developers did a very well job and I'm happy to support them.

reviewText: The writing in this CYOA game was disjointed.  The transitions were clumsy.  I found the characters hard to care about.  Late in the game, stat challenges started to be hard to decipher into their associated stats.  The narrative proceeded with a strong sense of inevitability such that individual choices didn't matter much, but this last one certainly seems to have been the intent of the author; frustration with the inevitable is a recurring theme of the story.\n\nI enjoyed it, but only because I enjoy the genre.  I'll probably play it a few more times, but I can't recommend it to others.

reviewText: I really enjoy a lot of the Choice of Games titles. I wasn't sure if this one would end up standing out or not from the demo, but it did. Then length is very good, so it's worth it's money at least in content. It doesn't tackle any particularly new ideas, but it's not trying to as much as set you in an ancient tale. This is fine, it does it well. You feel like you have quite a bit of agency, some of the twists are not easily predicted, I found no obvious bugs in mechanics or dialogue, the stats you built are meaningful and consistant, and the writing quality stays solid through to the end. It might not be a title I recomend to people who are new to text adventures or CoG brand in particular over some other riveting titles, but it is a really enjoyable game. The price is pretty reasonable for the content, but if you're not sure about it, picking it up during a sale is resonable. If you come to enjoy the genre, definitely check out their website for more of their games since they're not all on Steam. Every game has a free demo, and a handful are free all the way through.\n\nTL;DR: Fun game if you're already a text/CoG fan, if not, pick it up on sale and give it a try anyway. I enjoyed it.

reviewText:
Don't get me wrong, Champion of the Gods isn't horrible. Its simply not a good game. While enjoyable for the first playthrough it doesn't take long to figure out that you have actually very little choice indeed. This especially shows on multiple playthroughs.

No matter what you do you will be swept towards the three major endings, there's little to no chance for death (unless third ending) and you feel rather constrained by the wondrous leaps involved to keep you on your path.

So, while good to read through once or so, I cannot recommend picking this one up unless it is on a bargain-bin sale price.

reviewText:
Champion of the Gods is an exceptional interactive novel.
Sink yourself into the a fantastic world inspired in the hellenic polis and embrace a magical quest to fullfill or avoid your destiny against the god's will!
I loved how well written this game is and how immersive, it feels like you're the protagonist of an heroic narration like the Odyssey itself!
The ambiance, the description of the places, character personalities are well documented, well made and they feel like an epic narration of those eras. I recommend a lot this game, specially for the ones who have a special love towards those classic civilizations, like I do.

reviewText:
TLDR:
If you like interactive stories that carries a good tale, then this game is for you. Be kind, be vicious, be deceitful, it is your choice.


This interactive novel that is inspired by Greek myth is written very well. It has a mix of peace, action and drama. I have enjoyed it so far. The replayability is huge and feels always different. This story is my 5,00 Euro worth. If you like reading interactive stories then Champion of the Gods is worth it. You can do it with friends and family, asking how to person would act. You can create many character personalities, someone who is cynical about god or one who is zealous or cut everyone in your way with your anger. It is your story.

Pros
- Multiple ways
- Good balance between action and peace.
- Low priced
- Simple English
- Very entertaining
- Long stories

Cons
- No music. (Is easy to fix, just get some good music in the background)

reviewText:
I really like the story and i'm still playing it.

I Know this is a text-adventure game, but it's still too lazy on the front-end side. As a designer, here are my notes to improve that feedback;

Better Typography for less stressful reading experience

- I think the typography is really weak. The dialogues, story and any other text-based information uses the same style. I think the emotions, the story and the dialogues should be used with different typographic presentation. (for example; dialogues should be bigger and more contrast in color, whereas the story could be a bit smaller.) I believe this will in general reduce the stress for the pages that have TOO MUCH TEXT.


Sounds (Background / Ambient) as feedback

- Also, i think background music / ambient sounds would be very effective for the game. When in battle, a more dramatic music, or when in a Town Hall or somewhere near danger, a bit stressful music. Also when your attempt fails or works. I mean there are tons of opportunities of aural feedbacks.


Subtle Visual Elements

- Yes i still know it's a text-adventure game, but subtle visual elements would enhance the gameplay feedback still.
For example some background image when your environment changes, or again, when you success or fail. Or when one of your stat increases - decreases, or you have a new gift etc. I'll talk about that in the GUI section.


GUI

The game also has GUI in the stats" section. Which contains your characters summary
hoursPlayed: gifts etc. These are visual elements
voteText: but for some reason they are poorly presented
helpfulPercent: and even hidden from the game. Text is visual
votesHelpful: and i think representing those Attributes
votesFunny: Items etc. in-game as a Graphical User Interface would be much more powerful. (Blizzard's spell icons is a nice example)\n\nThose elements i just mentioned are used in the game called Cypher
commentsCount: it looks like a REALLY nice text-based game. I just think being a text-adventure game does not compensate the lack of visuals still. I'm having fun
column16: but i sometimes get bored when it's a huge chunk of text with no visual polishes in it.\n\nI recommend it though."

God killed in the first 20 minutes.\n11/10 would get killed again.
If you get it on any kind of sale, you won't regret it. It's not too long of a game, about 14 hours or so, but it's very interesting, and kept me going until the end, taking me only 3 days to finish.

reviewText: This choose your own adventure is fun to play.  All the decisions you make affect your character in some way.  I'm excited to play more games like it.

I was surprised by how good this was, very much worth the $5 asking price.
Many meaningful choices, and my first playthrough (approx 5 hours in length) ended with a surprising twist.

Complaints:
No undo button. A couple of choices are a bit vague, and it'd be nice to be able to go back when you realize something is completely different from what you thought it was.

No option to reverse the colors, for white text on a black background. May hurt your eyes after a while.

Truly a great tale woven by great Weavers(Slight spoiler), the tale was great and amazing I can only wish that others will tell the tale from their view.(Hinting that there are mutliple paths)
fun would play again
It was amazing. A bit of background music would be nice tho.

A charming little choose your own adventure type game, with fantastic storytelling and different outcomes dependant on your choices (Wooow, it's not like it's a CYOA or anything.).

More of a book than a game, this is very much recommended for fans of literature and mythology.

Four weavers out of five.

Let me begin by stating that by now “Choice of games” have established a certain minimal level of quality one expects to find in their products. Hence I will not waste my time complimenting the brilliance of writing and intricacy of the game’s world – these elements are default for them, which are a great responsibility and a sign of player’s trust at the same time. Let us instead consider this particular gem.
Upon reading about the game being inspired by Greek myths I dreaded the prospect of dealing with another mash of centaurs and gorgons for the tenth time. Boy was I mistaken. There is none of typical tropes of ancient Greece in this story. There is no Zeus or Hades; in fact you probably will not meet any of the familiar names. So what is the deal with Greek inspiration then? The developers done somethings I didn’t dare to dream of. They have captured to vibe of ancient Greek tragedy in their narrative. The feeling of a struggle against forces beyond your control or comprehension permeates the story. The questions of fate and free will aren’t mere peculiarity any more – they are vital. And no matter what you do the gods will screw you at their first whim in ways you can’t even guess. You are just a pawn in a giant game of cosmic chess.
…
Or are you?
…
This is a very exciting game. “Choice of robots” probably still holds the gold, but “Champion of the Gods” takes a definitive silver amongst the developer’s works.
its a great story and the fact that you can change it to fit your personality just makes it better

Champion of the Gods is a great story! it can hardly be called a game, but the story you get is exsiting and you can choose what kind of person you want to be. you can be a religius man biding the will of the gods or curse the gods and destroy desteny itself. Champion of the gods story does not change much depending on you choises, but you Champion does and they way he feels about the other charecters. i recomend buying this game if you want a good story to read, but it is hardly a game. more like a short story if not a novel
Game was so good, that I played through it.

Okay now. I think this is my first opinion given to a game.
I'll be honest, i was a little reluctant due to the fact that it's only text and that, even though i speak it fluently, english isn't my first language.
But now i'm gonna speak, so far, this game has been incredible.
After 6 hours taken realy slowly, i've felt the need to do this because there were some times when i felt: fock, do i want to do whatever it takes for my character to become stronger or do i want to play him like i designed him and how i realy feel.
Until now i've only chosen le second option, but there were times where it just pained me, and it felt so great being so concerned about the choices of a simple text game!! I hope that just like in life, having some principles will give me some of a reward ^^.
Seriously, if you ever feel like you could enjoy the game, just buy it, it's quite cheap and brought me as much excitement as some games/mangas/books/shows/films that i have played/read/seen.
In my opinion, putting in some well drawn pictures once in a while could make it even better, but after i finished this game, i'm still gonna rerun it, and when i'll be bored of this one, i'll buy another of the same style.

My opinion : JUST-FOCKING-GOOD

I'm really getting into these stories! This one was fairly well-written, decent player agency, with a fun faux-Greek setting. It rests on some large themes without crushing you under their weight. Good times. I stayed up late to finish reading.
good but if you want to explore every choose it's a bit long
My nostalga for choose your own adventure books brought me to purchace this. I was not disapointed.

Beautifully written—leaves plenty to the imagination, depending on how vividly you can recreate the scenes and fantastic visuals. If you're looking to find a renewed love for Greek mythology or just simply delve into a storyline thick with consequences and real-world ethical dilemmas...look no further. I really feel the rawness of suspense as well as the thrill of action while playing this interactive story.\n\nTake a break from the visually pleasing RPGs or shoot-em-ups that don't leave much to the imagination. You'll be surprised how fun it is!

This is one of my text adventure game ive ever played. You have choices upon choices and its really interesting how they can play out. There is great replayability and  it comes pretty cheap! Definetly recommend it if you enjoy having full control over what choices your character makes.
An enjoyable little story.

date: so this seemed right up my alley. This couldve easily been a purchase regretted
recommended: fueled by nostalgia........but it wasn't. The writing is solid. The use of skill checks and traits you acquire by choice required for them is a slight RPG twist to the basic formula. I enjoyed the story that resulted from my choices. It was a consistent
voteText: and imaginative little journey for a few bucks.\n\nI cant speak on the replayability or full variance in choices

OVERALL- 8.5

Its a fun spin on an old concept. If you enjoy reading its a couple hours of fun. Consider it a interactive movie ticket for someone with an imagination."

An awe-inspiring game, best of the Choice of Games series
I absolutely loved this game. Even though you can get through it in just a couple hours, it's really fun to do and has a good and solid story. Recommended!

You know it's good game when you accidentally ruin the world but still get married, but i got sad that you couldnt redo the last fight :/

Great game. Took me about three hours to finish my first playthrough. Great story even if it's a bit predictable. Some nice twists and dilemma.

If you're a fan of greek mythology and others choice of games, you'll surely enjoy Champion of the Gods.

Very well written and very enjoyable the first time I played through it. I'm not sure about replaying it because many things will repeat themselves regardless of your decisions, but that first play through I would say is worth the money for it.
A amazing and cheap game with a great story

Really good story lots of choice, really enjoyed all the characters and their development as well as a few twists. However this game is like many others in its Genre - Annoyingly short. I would say the average person could complete it in a mere 4 hours perhaps less if you are a fast reader. I'd recommend buying it on sale however I've paid more for much worse. I'd give the game an 8 out of 10 for story but it is hardly a game by most standards so this game obviously isn't for everyone.

In a world of AAA titles with breathtaking graphics, I suppose it's strange to some that people still buy and play these dinosaurs... But much like a how a book can pull you in, this story can be so engrossing that you look past the archaic nature of it and enjoy it for the sum of it's parts.

Because I've played some of their previous titles and trust in this developer to deliver quality text games, I jumped on this when I saw it on sale for 2.99. It did not disappoint.

You play the role of a mortal that gradually becomes aware of their growing power, and of a greater destiny. But this power does not come freely, and the responsibilities that come with embracing it ( or are thrust upon you, depending on your character ) lead to many challenges.

The game borrows here and there from Greek culture, mythology, and folklore to set up a world to tell the story you want to read. You can play the part of the brave warrior, a reluctant hero, a cruel tyrant, etc. The story itself will generally go in the same vague direction every time, but enough of the details change that if you can get absorbed in your character and the various outcomes, you will enjoy it.

The only things that bothered me were that sometimes the choices didn't make it clear which stat an action drew upon. For instance, during a battle scene, I thought throwing a spear might rely upon dexterity and quickness, and chose it because I thought it fit my character. Nope! Turns out it's more strength than anything else. There's a few moments like that, but you can figure out the lion's share of the choices.

All in all, I had fun with it. It took me just over 5 hours from start to finish, but I feel I got my money's worth, and I've yet to start my second run. The ending hints at more games to come in the series, and I sure hope so. I want my chance to break even with the Gods for all the guff they've given me.
Became a homosexual who did just about nothing but take a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of punches like a badass, then destroyed all of destiny and a god out of nowhere because of my secret agenda. 10/10
Nice game, if you got abit of fantasy it will make your day ~ and for now 2,99€ is worth it !

Easily one of the best interactive novels I've played. Had more fun with this one than all the 'Heroes Rise' stories put together. Might also be because I like the overall setting better, who needs super powers when you can stylishly dismount some bandit from his horse? Also I got to kill a giant snake monster thingy by slicing up it's heart, because I'm a badass. Hahahaha! Oh, also may have kinda wrecked a city...whoops...

Pros:
-Multiple endings
-Story is really good
-Setting is really nice, I could actually pictured a Greek-esque landscape and everything
-You really like you are the character engaging in battle and being diplomatic. Atleast I did personally.

Cons:
-linear is certain places, but that's the nature of these kinda games.
-Attribute system seemed a bit, unbalanced. Hopefully a sequal or spin-off will have an improved version it.
